distortions.name: Catastrophizing
distortions.description: Catastrophizing is when someone thinks that the worst possible thing will happen, even if it's not likely at all. For example, if you have a test and you think, "If I get one question wrong, I will fail the whole grade!" That's catastrophizing because it's imagining something way, way worse than what will probably happen.
distortions.tip: üí° Tips and tricks: What word do you see? That's right; Catastrophe. A catastrophe is a horrific event. So Catastrophizing is when you believe the absolute worst will happen.
examples: I'm gonna lose my friend forever
I'll never get better at school
I'm gonna mess up the whole thing
I don't think they like me at all
We'll never be able to get along
My parents will never see my point of view
My family members will never get me

distortions.name: Personalization
distortions.description: Personalization is thinking everything is your fault, even when it isn't your fault at all. Imagine your friend is having a bad day, and you think they are upset because of something you did, even if it's not true. It's like wearing tinted glasses that make you see everything as your responsibility. But in reality, many things happen for different reasons, not just because of you.
distortions.tip: üí° Tips and tricks: What word do you see? Person? Personal? Something is personal when it has to do with you or your business. So personalization is when you believe everyone's feelings and struggles are because of you.
examples: This fight is all my fault
My anxiety is my fault
I'm embarrassed and it's my fault
I was left out because I did something wrong
If my classmates don't pay attention to me, it's because I have a bad presentation
My classmate was mean to me because I did something wrong
I got a poor grade because I'm not smart
Since we're in a disagreement, we're not a good family
My family doesn't understand me because I'm weird

distortions.name: All or Nothing Thinking
distortions.description: All or Nothing thinking is thinking in extremes. It's like only seeing things as either all good or all bad. For example, imagine you're trying to draw a picture, and you think, "If my drawing isn't perfect, then it's terrible!" This kind of thinking can make you feel upset because you're not seeing all the good things about your picture, even if it's not perfect. **If you're a perfectionist, you might struggle with this one!
distortions.tip: üí° Think about this: When you mix black and white, what do you get? That's right, gray! The same way that a dark and light color can create an in-between color, things aren't either completely horrible or perfect, they can be okay; in between.
examples: If my friend and I are fighting, I must be a terrible friend
I'm never going to get over this anxiety
I made a mistake, which makes me a clumsy person
I felt left out today, so my friends must not like me
If I don't make my presentation perfect, it's not worth doing at all
Since they were mean today, they'll probably be mean everyday
If I'm struggling in a class, I'm not a good student at all
Since we have fights, we must be bad siblings

actionMatches.feeling: You're nervous about a class presentation

actionMatches.feeling: You feel annoyed after having a fight with a sibling

actionMatches.feeling: You feel anxious because basketball tryouts are coming up
